userId.description: Reference to User who reported the issue.

category.description: Category of the reported issue (e.g., potholes, street lighting).

severity.description: Severity level of the reported issue (e.g., low, medium, high).

description.description: Detailed description of the reported issue.

location.description: User-provided string for the issue's location.

imageUrl.description: URL to an image of the issue.

imageHint.description: AI-generated hint for the image content, used for accessibility and search.

status.description: Current status of the issue (e.g., reported, in progress, resolved).

upvotes.description: Number of upvotes the issue has received.

reporterName.description: Name of the user who reported the issue.

reporterAvatarUrl.description: Avatar URL of the user who reported the issue.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was last updated.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. Access is restricted to the user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

definition.description: Stores publicly visible issue reports that anyone can view.

params.name: issueId
params.description: The unique identifier of the issue report.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed for a public-facing issue board. The top-level `issues` collection is publicly readable, allowing anyone to see the reported problems. The `users` collection stores private user data, accessible only by the owning user.
